trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> objects.
Use the StyleCollection class to store and manage <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> objects for a control.
Control developers can use this class to contain a set of styles that apply to different portions of the control.
The collection dynamically increases in size as objects are added.
Indexes in this collection are zero-based.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection.Count%2A> property to determine how many objects are in the collection.

Additionally, use the StyleCollection methods and properties to provide the following functionality: - The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection.Add%2A> method to add a single style to the collection.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection.Insert%2A> method to add a style at a particular index within the collection.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection.Remove%2A> method to remove a style from the collection.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method to remove the style located at a particular index.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection.Contains%2A> method to determine whether a particular style is already in the collection.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to retrieve the index of a style within the collection.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection.Clear%2A> method to remove all the styles from the collection.
Appends a specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object to the end of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection"></xref> object.
Use the Add method to append the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object to the end of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection> object.
To add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object to the collection at a specific index location, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection.Insert%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object to add to the collection.
The index at which the style was added to the collection.
Determines whether the specified style is contained within the collection.
The Contains method determines equality by using the <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A> method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> objects.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> to locate within the collection.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the style is in the collection; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Copies the elements of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection"></xref> to a one-dimensional <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> array, starting at the specified index of the target array.
The style elements are copied to the <xref:System.Array> object in the same order in which they are indexed within the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection> object.
The <xref:System.Array> that is the destination of the copied styles.
The <xref:System.Array> must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in `styleArray` at which copying begins.

Creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> class, based on the single element collection returned by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection.GetKnownTypes*> method.

The index, from the ordered list of types returned by <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection.GetKnownTypes*>, of the type of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.IStateManager"></xref> object to create. Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection.GetKnownTypes*> method of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection"></xref> returns a list with only one type, the input `index` is ignored.
An instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> class.
Gets an array of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.IStateManager"></xref> types that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection"></xref> can contain.

An array containing one <xref:System.Type> object for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> class, which indicates that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection"></xref> can contain <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> objects.
Returns the index of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object within the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection.Contains%2A> method determines equality by using the <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A> method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> objects.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> to locate within the collection.
The zero-based index of the first occurrence of style within the collection; otherwise, -1 if the style is not in the collection.
Inserts a specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object into the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection"></xref> at the specified index location.
Use the Insert method to insert a specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object into the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection> object at a specified index location.

To add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object at the end of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection> object, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection.Add%2A> method.
The zero-based index location at which to insert the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object to insert into the collection.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object at the specified index location in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection"></xref> object.
Use this indexer to access a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection> at the specified index, using simple array notation.
The indexer allows you to modify or replace a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object in the collection directly.
The zero-based index location of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object at the specified index in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection"></xref>.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection"></xref> object.
Use the Remove method to remove the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection> object.
All items that follow the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object are then moved up to fill in the vacant position.
The indexes of the moved items are also updated.

To remove a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection> object at a specific index location, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method.
You can also remove every <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object in the collection using the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection.Clear%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object to remove from the collection.
Removes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object at the specified index location from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection"></xref> object.
Use the RemoveAt method to remove the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object at a specified index location from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection> object.
All items that follow that <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object are then moved up to fill in the vacant position.
The indexes of the moved items are also updated.

To remove a specific <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection> object, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.StyleCollection.Remove%2A> method.
You can also remove every <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object in the collection using the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection.Clear%2A> method.
The zero-based index location of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object to remove.
Instructs the input <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object contained in the collection to record its entire state to view state, rather than recording only change information.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object that should serialize itself completely.
